headline: Wisconsin Blue Ribbon Chili
name: Wisconsin Blue Ribbon Chili
description: A Wisconsin chili recipe that is mild, sweet, tomatoey, and full of macaroni noodles. This makes a hearty pot in only 1 hour from start to finish.

recipeInstructions.text: Place ground beef into a large soup pot over medium heat. Cook beef until it begins to lose its pink color, about 8 minutes. Break the meat up into crumbles as it cooks. Stir in celery, bell pepper, and onion. Continue to cook until beef is browned, about 8 more minutes. Drain excess fat.

Stir in diced tomatoes, tomato juice, water, chili powder, brown sugar, and beef bouillon cubes; cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 30 minutes. Stir in macaroni and continue simmering until the pasta is tender, 10 to 15 more minutes.
